questions.question: An arriving VFR flight shall make initial radio contact with the control tower

answers.1: upon entering an Aerodrome Traffic Zone.

questions.question: VFR flight within Class B airspace is permitted

answers.1: only when the flight visibility is 5 miles or better.
answers.2: for all aircraft except gliders and balloons.
answers.3: if the pilot holds a Class B Airspace Endorsement.
answers.4: in accordance with an ATC clearance.

references: CARs 601.07 - VFR Flight in Class B Airspace

answers.1: immediately after entering the Control Zone.

questions.question: Unless otherwise authorized, a pilot on a VFR flight operating within a Class C terminal control area must

answers.1: exit the airspace whenever the weather deteriorates below VFR limits.
answers.2: establish radio contact with the appropriate ATC unit only when transiting the associated control zone.
answers.3: establish and maintain radio communication with the appropriate ATC Unit.
answers.4: contact radar service only when taking off or landing at the major airport concerned.

references: CARs 601.08 - VFR Flight in Class C Airspace
TC AIM-RAC - Class C Airspace
